alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 1:42PM MST until July 25 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: At 141 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley, Prescott, Dewey-humboldt, Poland Junction, Walker, Prescott Gateway Mall, Mayer, Groom Creek Subdivision, Oak Knoll Village, Downtown Prescott, Prescott Airport, Spring Valley, Cordes Junction, Lynx Lake Dam, Prescott Valley Event Center, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and White Spar Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 296. Interstate 17 between mile markers 261 and 266. State Route 89 between mile markers 311 and 320. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 325. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
